body:
I, as an Asian, have kept my grades since freshmen year to A's only, and am pressured by my parents to go to a good school (not necessarily Ivy, as Caltech, Stanford, MIT aren't Ivy but still insanely good). 

If you're not in high school (or even middle school) yet, then I guess just say what you wanna be when you grow up. 

Me: Stanford University in California
Career: Aeronautical Engineer

replies.body:
It's all a matter of how much college costs at that point.  If it's the same as it is now, I'd go to whatever school I want, likely something such as Carnegie, Massachusetts Institute of Technology, or Stanford. 

If it's gotten higher or worse, I'd just go to Oklahoma State University in my home town.

replies.body: Yup, I went to Stanford's and they said the same thing: "Need-based aid". But the lady said that if your parents have a salary of more than about 100K, then there's less of a chance (unless you have multiple children in college and need aid to pay for all of them).
